channel.title: How to execute AQL queries on ArangoDB Documentation
channel.description: Recent content in How to execute AQL queries on ArangoDB Documentation

item.title: Executing AQL queries from _arangosh_
item.description: In the ArangoDB shell, you can use the db._query() and db._createStatement() methods to execute AQL queries. This chapter also describes how to use bind parameters, counting, statistics and cursors. With db._query() db._query(<queryString>) â†’ cursor You can execute queries with the _query() method of the db object. This runs the specified query in the context of the currently selected database and returns the query results in a cursor. You can print the results of the cursor using its toArray() method:

item.title: Executing AQL queries in the ArangoDB web interface
item.description: In the QUERIES section of the web interface, type in a query in the main box and execute it by clicking the Execute button. The query result is displayed below the editor. The editor provides a few example queries that you can use as templates. It also provides a feature to explain a query and inspect its execution plan by clicking the Explain button. Bind parameters can be defined in the right-hand side pane.
